results.title: Electrostatic charges and forces
results.brief_description: This film shows how positive and negative charges are created: defines such basic concepts as insulator, conductor and electric field; and introduces Coulomb’s law, used to measure electrostatic charges. A laboratory demonstration of Faraday’s ice-pail experiment is presented. The film also shows how the principles of electrostatic charges and forces can be used to explain the operation of the Van de Graaff generator.
results.description: This film shows how positive and negative charges are created: defines such basic concepts as insulator, conductor and electric field; and introduces Coulomb’s law, used to measure electrostatic charges. results.title: Electron arrangement and bonding
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: chemistry”.
The purpose of these six episodes is to show the importance of the electron to chemical compunds. Illustrates the development of the atomic model by scientists such as Bohr, Rutherford and Planch, and relates their contributions to an understanding of the function of electrons. Highlights various aspects of energy levels, orbitals, charges, relative mass, bonding and electron configuration. Includes: 1. “Introduction to the players”, 2. “The Rutherford-Bohr atom”, 3. “Electron arrangement”, 4. “How atoms bond”, 5. “Molecular substance and covalent crystals”, 6. “Metals and ionic solids.”

results.title: Electromagnetism
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
The historical discovery of the magnetic properties of lodestone led to a scientific understanding of Earth’s magnetic field. Six ten minute computer-animated episodes explore this mysterious force from early experiments to the concepts of electromagnetic induction, the motor principle, generators, and transformers. It also looks at fascinating modern theories about the role of the Earth’s magnetic field in the extinction of species and at the ways that animals use it for navigation. The programs include: 1. Earth’s magnetic field 4. The Motor principle 2. Magnetism and electron flow 5. Electromagnetic induction 3. Domain theory 6. Life in the field

results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Teaches the basic concepts of electrochemical cells, starting with the question of how chemical reactions can be used to provide electricity using the displacement of silver from solution by copper

results.title: Electrochemistry
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontaria
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: chemistry”.
Shows students inside an everyday battery and explains the principles involved. Highlights the processes of electro-chemical reactions, how half-cell potentials can be determined, how electrochemistry is at work in the commercial Leclanche cell and the processes of corrosion and electrolysis. Each episode is ten minutes in duration: 1. The Building blocks of electrochemistry. 2. Electrochemical cells. 3. Designing electrochemical cells. 4. Commercial electrochemical cells. 5. Corrosion and 6. Electroplating.

results.title: Electrochemistry
results.brief_description: The following phenomena are studied in this film: the electrolytic decomposition of hydrogen chloride; the production of an electric current; the functioning of a storage battery; electroplating and the function of the electrodes; electro-refining and the action of preferential discharge; the precipitation of a solvent; the production of aluminium from a molten electrolyte.

results.title: Electricity: The Story
results.brief_description: An animated film that features a character called “Electro”. Electro explains what electricity is, how it is generated, and the way it is transmitted from a power station to the home. The film outlines the uses and the safety aspects of electricity.

results.title: Electricity
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Addresses the fundamentals of electrostatics and current electricity, helping students to form images of abstract concepts. The first three programs on electrostatics explains the charging of objects by contact and induction. The last three episodes on current electricity looks at electrical charge, current flow, potentail difference and resistance.

results.title: Electrical safety in the workplace
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Looks at the effects and potential hazards associated with electricity, including definitions of basic terms, facts about how electricity is conducted and the effects of electrical currents on the human body. It identifies common hazards found in the workplace including overhead power lines, damp locations and the use of extension cords, as well as the importance of insulation and wearing appropriate personal protective equipment. Presented by Peter Mitchell.
